title: Review MCP Server API Path Migration to Workspace-Aware Endpoints
description: User requested to replace all API paths with workspace-aware versions in the MCP tools. Upon investigation, the MCP server doesn't use HTTP API endpoints - it's a Model Context Protocol server that communicates via stdio and directly uses WorkspaceDevlogManager from the core package. Need to clarify what specific API paths need updating or if the user meant something else.

notes.content: Completed analysis of MCP server codebase. Found that MCP server doesn't use HTTP API paths - it's a stdio-based MCP server that already uses WorkspaceDevlogManager directly and is workspace-aware. Requested clarification from user about what specific API paths need updating.

Found the issue! The chat-tools.ts file contains 10 stub implementations that need to be updated to use workspace-aware WorkspaceDevlogManager. All chat functions are currently returning "not yet implemented in workspace-aware architecture" messages. These need proper implementations.
User clarified the issue - need to fix API paths in @devlog/web frontend components that are still using old non-workspace-aware endpoints instead of the new workspace-scoped paths.

Successfully fixed API paths in useDevlogDetails hook. Updated all fetch calls from old `/api/devlogs/*` to workspace-aware `/api/workspaces/{workspaceId}/devlogs/*` endpoints. Added workspace context integration. Web build completed successfully with no errors.
notes.codeChanges: Updated useDevlogDetails hook to use workspace-aware API endpoints by integrating useWorkspace hook and updating all fetch calls to include workspace ID in the path

context.businessContext: Ensuring the MCP server is properly integrated with the workspace-aware architecture
context.technicalContext: MCP server uses WorkspaceDevlogManager directly, not HTTP endpoints. The adapter already switches to current workspace before operations.
